title: Manchester United suffer huge injury blow ahead of Liverpool FA Cup clash
body_text:
Manchester United could be without key player Casemiro for Sunday's game against Liverpool after his withdrawal from the Brazil squad through injury.
The defensive midfielder has been a regular feature in the Premier League for Erik Ten Hag's side since returning from a knock in Janaury, having played in all but one league fixture this year. However, Casemiro could now be set to miss an 18th game of the season for United.
A statement from the Brazilian Football Federation have confirmed that Porto forward Pepe will replace the 32-year-old in the latest Selecao squad. Casemiro's withdrawal has led to question marks over whether he will be available for Sunday's FA Cup quarter-final at Old Trafford, reports the Manchester Evening News..

Brazil's coach, Dorival Junior said: "We have just received a report from Dr. Rodrigo Lasmar. From a pre-list made by the Brazilian National Team's technical committee with 50 names, 13 of them were already away due to injury at their clubs. Unfortunately, we also lost Casemiro. Therefore, Pepe, from Porto, a native striker who now plays as a midfielder, is called up."
The FA Cup is United's only hope of winning a trophy this season. Ten Hag's team also face a battle to secure Champions League football for next season as they currently sit eight points off the top four.
On a brighter note for United, forward Rasmus Hojland is fit for Sunday's match against Liverpool after recovering from a muscle injury. Mason Mount could also be back in action after being out since November with a calf problem.
